blocks.text: The image displays a logo consisting of the letters "BCE" in a bold, white, sans-serif typeface. The letters are set against a background divided into two equal horizontal sections: the top section is black, and the bottom section is white. The text is centrally aligned within the square frame of the logo.

छवि में एक गोलाकार स्टाम्प है जिस पर "FORT BEND COUNTY" लिखा है। इसके नीचे "APPROVED" लिखा है। बीच में लाल रंग में "OCT 3 1 2025" लिखा है। नीचे "Valid One Year From Date" और बाईं ओर "ENGINEERING DEPARTMENT" लिखा है। सबसे ऊपर "FBC ENGINEERING APPROVAL" लिखा है।
14. THE CONTRACTOR SHALL EXTEND SUBGRADE STABILIZATION TO 1' OUTSIDE THE EDGE OF PAVEMENT

1. THESE PLANS WERE PREPARED TO MEET OR EXCEED TEXAS COMMISSION ON ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY, FORT BEND COUNTY AND CITY OF FULSHEAR RULES AND REGULATION AS CURRENTLY AMENDED BY THE STATE WATER CODE STANDARDS; THE MORE STRICT SHALL APPLY. CONSTRUCTION FOR PUBLIC WATER SYSTEMS MUST ALWAYS AT A MINIMUM MEET TEO'S "RULES AND REGULATIONS FOR PUBLIC WATER SYSTEMS."

2. WATER LINES, WASTEWATER COLLECTION SYSTEMS, AND DRAINAGE SYSTEMS SHALL BE CONSTRUCTED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE CITY OF FULSHEAR SUBDIVISION ORDINANCE NO. 04-913, UNLESS OTHERWISE NOTED AND APPROVED ON THESE PLANS: The design is consistent with current state and local standards for water lines (including but not limited to minimum depths of burial); all construction shall comply with applicable city or Fort Bend County regulations concerning surface drainage ordinances within City limits as well as any other county requirements that may apply such as those found at www.fortbendcountytx.gov/water_rules/. All stormwater discharges issued into the city of Fulshear where the City of FULSHEAR subdivision ordinance and/or Fort Bend County regulations conflict with the City of Houston standard construction specifications should be modified accordingly by reference to these plans unless they are inconsistent therewith which would require a variance from said plan provisions under section C(5) above if approved on an individual basis based upon site conditions including variances among and/or fort Bend County regulation, the City of Houston standard construction specifications should also meet additional criteria set forth herein below regarding storm sewer systems designed specifically per each project location due consideration being given towards minimizing impacts associated with public utilities located along existing utility rights-of-way while maintaining adequate flow rates throughout system components without compromising safety levels required during normal operation periods.

3. THE CONTRACTOR SHALL BE FULLY RESPONSIBLE FOR ANY AND ALL DAMAGE TO THE EXISTING PUBLIC UTILITY LINES OR PRIVATE UTLITY LINES INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO WATER LINES, WASTEWATER COLLECTION SYSTEMS AND STORM SEWERS, DURING CONSTRUCTION. ALL DAMAGES SHALL BE REPAIRED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE CITY OF FULSHEAR SUBDIVISION ORDINANCES NO. 06-87 & -88.

4. UNLESS SPECIFICALLY INDICATED OTHERWISE ON THE PLANS, UTILITIES WITHIN EASEMENTS SHALL BE LOCATED IN ACCORDANCE WITH STANDARDS OUTLINED BY THE MOST CURRENT UTILITY COORDINATING COMMITTEE DRAWINGS.

5. AUTHORIZATION NOTICE ISSUED BY FORT BEND COUNTY PUBLIC INFRASTRUCTURE ENGINEERING DEPARTMENT PERMIT OFFICE REQUIRED PRIOR TO CONSTRUCTION OF UTILITIES OR LEFT TURN LANES WITHIN FORT BEND COUNTY RIGHT-OF-WAY CONTACT FORT BEND COUNTY PUMP STATION OFFICE 281-633-7502.

6. CONTRACTOR SHALL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR LOCATING AND PROTECTING ALL EXISTING UTILITIES AND OTHER FACILITIES.

CONTRACTOR SHALL COMPLY WITH OCCUPATIONAL SAFETY AND HEALTH ADMINISTRATION STANDARDS AND ANY OTHER FEDERAL, STATE AND LOCAL REGULATIONS REGARDING TRENCH SAFETY SYSTEMS FOR Trench Excavation.

ADEQUATE DRAINING STRUCTURES MAINTAINED AT ALL TIMES DURING CONSTRUCTION AND ANY DRAINAGE DITCH OR STRUCTURE DISTURBED DURING CONSTRUCTION. CONSTRUCTION SHALL BE RESTORED TO THE SATISFACTORY CONDITION CONTAINED AT ALL TIMES BEFORE STARTING CONSTRUCTION.

9. CONTRACTOR TO OBTAIN ANY CONSTRUCTION PERMITS REQUIRED BY FORT BEND COUNTY AND TEXAS FOR FLOOD PLAIN MANAGEMENT PRIOR TO STARTING CONSTRUCTION.

10. CONDITION OF THE ROAD AND/OR RIGHT-OF-WAY, UPON COMPLETION OF JOB, SHALL BE AS GOOD OR BETTER THAN CONDITION PRIOR TO STARTING WORK.

11. CONTRACTOR SHALL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR NOTIFYING ALL PIPELINE COMPANIES WITHIN THE VICINITY OF CONSTRUCTION ACTIVITIES PRIOR TO THE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK.

12. CONTRACTOR SHALL BE REQUIRED TO MAINTAIN ORANGE PROTECTIVE FENCING IN ALL AREAS OF WORK PER THOSE CONSTRUCTION PLANS.

13. CONTRACTOR SHALL MARK CURB WITH A SAW CUT #IV* INDICATING THE LOCATION OF NON-POTABLE WATER LINE GATE VALVES.

PRIOR TO COMMENCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION, THE OWNER OF THE SYSTEM OR HIS REPRESENTATIVE MUST NOTIFY THE APPROPRIATE TCEQ REGIONAL OFFICE IN WRITING OF THE DATE ON WHICH CONSTRUCTION WILL BEGIN.

SANITARY SENSORS:

1. EACH SANITARY PIPE SHALL BE SUBJECT TO A STANDARD EXFILTRATION TEST. TESTS ARE TO BE PERFORMED ON THE TOTAL FOOTAGE OF SEWER LINE INCLUDED IN THE PROJECT. REQUIREMENTS OF 30 TEXAS ADMINISTRATIVE CODE, CHAPTER 317, "DESIGN CRITERIA FOR SEVERAGE SYSTEMS" SHALL BE FOLLOWED WHERE NOT COVERED BY CITY OF FULSHEAR.

2. SANITARY SEWIP PIPE TO BE SRD 26 P.V.C. PIPE MEETING ASTMA SPECIFICATIONS Q0304 WITH RUBBER GASKET JOINTS, UNLESS OTHERWISE NOTED.

3. SANITARY SEWERS WILL HAVE BEDDING AND BACKFILL PER CITY OF FULSHEAR SUBSIDIOR DIVISION ORDER No. 04-913 dated 10/20/05 AND DETAILS INCLUDED IN THIS PLAN SET.

4. ALL SANITARY SEWER LINES UNDER PROPOSED OR FUTURE PAVEMENT AND TO A POINT 1 FOOT BACK OF ALL PROPOSED OR FUTURE CURBS SHALL HAVE REDDING PER CYL OF FULSHEAR SUBDIVISION ORDINANCE NO. 04-913 DATED 10/20/05 AND DETAILS INCLUDED IN THIS PLAN SET, WITH A MINIMUM 1.5 BAGS COCONUT/MINTEN (MIN. 100 PSI AT 46 HR.) STABILIZED SAND BACKFILL UP TO WITHIN ONE (1) FOOT OF PAVING SUBGRADE. TEST REPORTS TO BE SUBMITTED BEFORE PLACEMENT OF PAVEMENT. SAND SHALL BE PLACED IN BETWEEN 4 FEET ABOVE GROUND LEVEL IF NECESSARY.

6. ALL MANNHOLES ARE TO BE PER CITY OF FULSHEAR SUBDIVISION ORDINANCE NO. 04-913 DATED 10/20/05 AND DETAILS INCLUDED IN THIS PLAN SET AND SHALL MEET REQUIREMENTS OF ASTM C478 PART II SECTION III TABLE I.

ALL MANNHOLES ARE TO BE PER CITY OF FULSHEAR SUBDIVISION ORDINANCE NO. 04-913 DATED 10/20/05 AND DETAILS INCLUDED IN THIS PLAN SET AND SHALL MEET REQUIREMENTS OF ASTM C478 PART II SECTION IV TABLES VI THROUGH IX.

6. ALL SANITARY SEWERS CROSSING WATER LINES SHALL FOLLOW THE "PROTECTIVE REQUIREMENTS FOR SANITARY SEWER CROSSINGS" CRITERIA PER CITY OF HOUSTON DESIGN MANUAL AND MEET TECU RULE 26O-(A)(4)(X)(VI)*WHICH REQUIRES:

a. ((220.44)-(AX)-VIII)*(VI)(REQUIRIES THAT WHERE A NEW POTABLE WATERLINE CROSSES A NEW, PRESSURE RATED WASTEWATERS (OR NON-POTABLE WATER) MAIN OR LATERAL, ONE SEGMENT OF THE WATERLINE PIPE SHALL BE CENTERED OVER AND SHALL BE PERPENDICULAR TO THE WASHTEAWATER (OR NON-POTABLE WATER) LINE SUCH THAT THE JOINT OF THE WATERLINE PIPE IS EQUAL TO OR GREATER THAN SIX INCHES ABOVE THE WATERSHED (OR NON-POTABLE WATER) MAIN OR LATERAL WHENEVER POSSIBLE, THE CROSSING SHALL BE CENTERED BETWEEN THE JOINTS OF THE WASHTEAWATER (OR NON-POTABLE WATER) MAIN AND LATERAL SIDE WALLS EXCEPT WHEN THERE EXISTS LESS THAN SIX INCHES ABOVE THE WASTEWATTER (OR NON-POTABLE WATER) MAIN OR LATERAL SIDEWALL BEING EMBEDED IN STAINLESS SAND (ZONA (-204AE)(K)(VII))FOR THE TOTAL LENGTH OF ONE PISEMENT PLUS 12 INCHES BEYOND EACH END.

b. ((220.44)-(AX)-VIII)*(VI).REQUIRES THAT WHERE A CERTIIFIED STABILIZER SAND BEDDING IS REQUIRED, THE STABILIZED SAND SHAVE, HAVE A MINIMUM OF 10% PERCENT CEMETER PER CUBIC YARD OF QUART ZAB OBLIQUE SAND STABILIZED SAND MIXTURE, BASED ON DRY LOAD WEIGHT VOLUME (AT LEAST 2.5 BAGS OF CEMENT PER CUBIC YARD OF MIXTURE), THE CEMENT STABILIZED SAND BEDDING SHALL BE A MINIMUM OF TWO MINUTES MAXIMUM TIME PERIOD OF MAINTENANCE WASHOUT INTERVALS SHOULD BE MET.

7. CONTRACTOR SHALL PROVIDE FOR A MINIMUM HORIZONTAL CLEARANCE OF 9' (NINE FEET) BETWEEN WATER LINES AND SANITARY SEWER MANHOLES AND LINES.

8. SANITARY SEWER MANHOLE RMS OUTSIDE OF PROPOSED PAVING WILL BE SET 3'-4" ABOVE THE SURROUNDING LEVEL FINISHED GRADE AFTER PAVING WITH SLOPPED BACKFILL ADDED FOR STORMWATER CONTROLS ONLY.

10. IN WET STABLE TRANCH AREAS USE BEDDING PER CITY OF HOUSTON SPECIFICATIONS AND DETAILS INCLUDED IN THIS PLAN SET.

11. ALL SEWER LEADST AND STAUCKS SHALL BE MARKED WITH A 4X4 LONG PVC PIPE OR STEEL OR 4X4 X 4" OD WOOD TIMBER AT THE TIME OF CONSTRUCTION. THE 4" P.V.C. PIPE SHALL EXTEND TWO FEET ABOVE BASE PLATE SURFACE FROM TOP EDGE OF TRAFFIC ROW INTO THE AREA OF INTERSECTION OF STREET CORNER WITHOUT REMOVING ANY EXISTING UTILITIES OR ALTERATIONS TO ITS POSITION ALONG THE ROADSIDE. ALL SEWER LEAD
1. WATER LINES SHALL BE P.V.C. CLASS 150, DR-18, AWWA C9OO-16.

BGE, Inc.
10777 Westheimer, Suite 400
Houston, TX 77042
Tel: 281-558-8700 • www.bgeinc.com
TBPE Registration No. F-1046

This image displays a circular official seal or stamp, likely from the State of Texas. The design features a thick, rope-like border enclosing the text and graphics. At the top, the text "STATE OF TEXAS" is arched along the upper curve. In the center, a five-pointed star is prominently displayed. Below the star, the text "ALEJANDRO DE LA ROSA" is centered on a horizontal line. The bottom section of the seal contains the number "140684" on the left and the words "LICENSED PROFESSIONAL ENGINEER" on the right, also following the curve of the seal. Small stars are positioned at the 12, 3, 6, and 9 o'clock positions on the outer border.

JOB NUMBER: 14451-00
SUBMITTED: BGE, INC.
SCALE: NTS
DATE: OCTOBER 2025
SURVEY BY: BGE, INC.
F B NO:		 DESIGNED BY: J.T.S.
DRAWN BY: J.T.S.
SHEET NO 2 OF 22 SHEETS

FORT BEND COUNTY - GENERAL CONSTRUCTION NOTES

1. FORT BEND COUNTY MUST BE INVITED TO THE PRE-CONSTRUCTION MEETING.

2. CONTRACTOR SHALL NOTIFY FORT BEND COUNTY ENGINEERING DEPARTMENT 48 HOURS PRIOR TO COMMENCING CONSTRUCTION AND 48 HOUR NOTICE TO ANY CONSTRUCTION ACTIVITY WITHIN THE LIMITS OF THE PAVING AT CONSTRUCTION@FBCTX.GOV

3. CONTRACTOR IS RESPONSIBLE FOR OBTAINING ALL PERMITS REQUIRED FROM FORT BEND COUNTY PRIOR TO COMMENCING CONSTRUCTION OF ANY IMPROVEMENTS WITHIN COUNTY ROAD RIGHT OF WAYS.

4. ALL PAVING IMPROVEMENTS SHALL BE CONSTRUCTED IN ACCORDANCE WITH FORT BEND COUNTY "RULES, REGULATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS" RELATING TO THE APPROVAL AND ACCEPTANCE OF IMPROVEMENTS IN SUBDIVISIONS AS CURRENTLY AMENDED.

5. ALL ROAD WIDTHS, CURB RADII AND CURB ALIGNMENT SHOWN INDICATES BACK OF CURB.

6. A CONTINUOUS LONGITUDINAL REINFORCING BAR SHALL BE USED IN THE CURBS.

7. ALL CONCRETE PAVEMENT SHALL BE 5½ SACK CEMENT WITH A MINIMUM COMPRESSIVE STRENGTH OF 3500 PSI AT 28 DAYS. TRANSVERSE EXPANSION JOINTS SHALL BE INSTALLED AT EACH CURB RETURN AND AT A MAXIMUM SPACING OF 60 FEET.

8. ALL WEATHER ACCESS TO ALL EXISTING STREETS AND DRIVEWAYS SHALL BE MAINTAINED AT ALL TIMES.

9. 4"X12" REINFORCED CONCRETE CURB SHALL BE PLACED IN FRONT OF SINGLE FAMILY LOTS ONLY. ALL OTHER AREAS SHALL BE 6" REINFORCED CONCRETE CURB.

10. CURB HEADERS ARE REQUIRED AT CURB CONNECTIONS TO HANDICAP RAMPS, WITH NO CONSTRUCTION JOINT WITHIN 5' OF RAMPs.

11. GUIDELINES ARE SET FORTH IN THE TEXAS "MANUAL ON UNIFORM TRAFFIC CONTROL DEVICES", AS CURRENTLY AMENDED, SHALL BE OBSERVED. THE CONTRACTOR SHALL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR PROVIDING ADEQUATE FLAGMEN, SIGNING, STRIPING AND WARNING DEVICES, ETC., DURING CONSTRUCTION - BOTH DAY AND NIGHT.

12. ALL R1-1 STOP SIGNS SHALL BE 30"X30" WITH DIAMOND GRADE SHEETING PER TEXAS MANUAL ON UNIFORM TRAFFIC CONTROL DEVICES.

13. STREET NAME SIGNAGE SHALL BE ON A 9" HIGH SIGN FLAT BLADE W/ REFLECTIVE GREEN BACKGROUND. STREET NAMES SHALL BE UPPER AND LOWERCASE LETTERING WITH UPPERCASE LETTERS OF 6" MINIMUM AND LOWERCASE LETTERS OF 4.5" MINIMUM. THE LETTERS SHALL BE REFLECTIVE WHITE. STREET NAME SIGNS SHALL BE MOUNTED ON STOP SIGN POST.

14. A BLUE DOUBLE REFLECTORIZED BUTTON SHALL BE PLACED AT ALL FIRE HYDRANT LOCATIONS. THE BUTTON SHALL BE PLACED 12 INCHES OFF OF THE CENTERLINE OF THE STREET ON THE SAME SIDE AS THE HYDRANT.

15. THE PROJECT AND ALL PARTS THEREOF SHALL BE SUBJECT TO INSPECTION FROM TIME TO TIME BY INSPECTORS DESIGNATED BY FORT BEND COUNTY. NO SUCH INSPECTIONS SHALL RELIEVE THE CONTRACTOR OF ANY OF ITS OBLIGATIONS HEREUNDER. NEITHER FAILURE TO INSPECT NOR FAILURE TO DISCOVER OR REJECT ANY OF THE WORK AS NOT IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE DRAWINGS AND SPECIFICATIONS, REQUIREMENT AND SPECIFICATIONS OF FORT BEND COUNTY OR ANY PROVISION OF THIS PROJECT SHALL BE CONSTRUED TO IMPLY AN ACCEPTANCE OF SUCH WORK OR TO RELIEVE THE CONTRACTOR OF ANY OF ITS OBLIGATIONS HEREUNDER.

16. STABILIZED SUBCRADE: DETERMINE THE THICKNESS OF THE STABILIZED SUBCRAKE AFTER CURING AND COMPACTION. IF THE SUBCRADE DEPTH IS GREATER THAN THE PROPOSED THICKNESS BY 20% OR MORE, THE CMT LAB MUST PROVIDE VERIFICATION THE PERCENTAGE OF MATERIAL BEING USED TO STABILIZE THE SUBCRADE MEETS OR EXCEEDS PROJECT REQUIREMENTS. TEST RESULTS REQUIRED.

17. CONTRACTOR TO PROVIDE MONTHLY SCHEDULE UPDATES AND WEEKLY LOOK AHEAD.

18. ALL DRAINAGE AND DETENTION CAPACITY MUST BE IN PLACE PRIOR TO BEGINNING ANY PAVING ACTIVITIES.

19. ALL TURN LANES AND MEDIAN OPENINGS SHALL HAVE THE SAME SURFACE AS THE EXISTING STREET. FROM THE ROW, ALL STREET AND DRIVEWAY CONNECTIONS SHALL HAVE THE SAME SURFACE AS THE EXISTING OR PROPOSED STREET.

20. MINIMUM DEPTH FOR BORES/UTILITIES SHALL BE AS FOLLOWS: OPEN DITCH - 3' MIN. BELOW FLOWLINE; 5' MIN. BELOW TOP OF PAVEMENT CURBED STREETS - 5' MIN. BELOW TOP OF PAVEMENT.

*NOTE: FORT BEND COUNTY NOTES SUPERSEDE ANY CONFLICTING NOTES

PIPELINE NOTES:

1. PRIOR TO ANY BORING, INSPECTION HOLES WILL BE EXCAVATED TO VERIFY THE DEPTH OF THE BORE AS IT APPROACHES EACH PIPE LINE. THE CONTRACTOR SHALL PROVIDE AND MAINTAIN INSTRUMENTATION TO ACCURATELY LOCATE THE BORING HEAD.

2. CONTRACTOR SHALL CONTACT DUSTIN MERCASO WITH DOW PIPELINE AT 979-264-9418, PRIOR TO ANY CONSTRUCTION IN DOW PIPELINE EASEMENTS CONTAINING GAS PIPELINE. 72 HOUR NOTICE REQUIRED.

3. CONTRACTOR SHALL CONTACT DILLOW HARPER WITH DOW PIPELINE AT 214-364-4066, PRIOR TO ANY CONSTRUCTION IN ATMOS PIPELINE EASEMENTS CONTAINING GAS PIPELINE. 72 HOUR NOTICE REQUIRED.

1. WATER LINES SHALL BE IN PVC CLASS 150, OR #8 AWWA C16-93.
2. ALL WATER LINES SHALL HAVE A @ BOTTOM AND 12" SIDE BANK - SAND ENVELOPES AND SHALL BE BACKFILLED TO A MINIMUM COMPACTED DEPTH OF AT LEAST THE TOP OF THE PIPE TO PROVIDE COMPACTED ENCASEMENT IN ACCORDANCE WITH SECTION 4(A).
3. WATER LINES UNDER PROPOSED OR FUTURE PAVING AND TO WITHIN 1 FOOT BACK OF ALL PROPOSED OR FUTURE CURBS SHALL BE ENCASCED IN BANK SAND TO 12" ABOVE PIPE AND BACKFILLED WITH 15"; SACK CEMENT/ITON STABILIZED SAND TO WITHIN ONE (1) FOOT OF SUBGRADE.
4. ALL FILL AND COMPACTION TO 95% STANDARD Proctor DENSITY SHALL BE PERFORMED PRIOR TO CONSTRUCTION OF WATER LINES.
5. CONTRACTOR SHALL PROVIDE FOR A MINIMUM SEPARATION DISTANCE IN ALL DIRECTIONS OF 9' (NINE FEET) BETWEEN WATER LINES AND SANITARY SEWER MANHOLES AND LINES. IF THIS DISTANCE CANNOT BE MAINTAINED, THE CONTRACTOR MUST IMMEDIATELY NOTIFY THE PROJECT ENGINEER FOR FURTHER DIRECTION. SEPARATION DISTANCES, INSTALLATION METHODS AND MATERIALS UTILIZED MUST MEET SECTION 269(a)(4) OF CURRENT RULES.
6. "WLE" INDICATES "WATER LINE ELAIGENCE".
7. ALL WATER PIPES ARE REQUIRED TO OPERATE ON AN AVERAGE ANNUAL FLOW RATE PERFORMANCE WITH AWWA Q10-. THEN FLUSH AND SAMPLE THE LINE BEFORE PREISING INTO SERVICE. A MINIMUM OF ONE BACTERIAL SAMPLE shall be collected for each 1,000 feet of completed waterline plus one set from the end of the line and at least one set from each ranch to check efficiency of disinfection procedures and shall be repeated if contamination persists.
8. ALL WATER PIPE AND RELATED PRODUCTS MUST CONFORM TO ANSI/NSF STANDARDIZED 61 AND MUST BE CERTIFIED BY AN ORGANIZATION ACCREDITED BY ANSI.
9. ALL FITTINGS TO MECHANICAL JOINTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH ANS: 21.1 PRESSURE RATED AT 250 PSi.
10. HYSTEROSTATIC TESTING: ALL WATER PIPE SHALL BE TESTED FOR LEAKAGE IN ACCORDANCE WITH AWWA G40-, SECTION 4 REQUIREMENTS FOR A DURATION OF NO LESS THAN TWO HOURS. LEAKAGE SHALL BE DEFINED AS THE QUANTITY OF WATER THAT PASSES THROUGH ANY PART OF THE SYSTEM DURING SUCH PERIODS WHEN IT IS FILLED UP TO ITS MAXIMUM CAPACITY WITHOUT EXCEEDING THE SPECIFIED TEST PRESSURE AFTER THE PIPE HAS BEEN FILLED WITH WATER AND THE AIR HAS BEEN EXPELLED. THE TEST PRESSURE SHALL BE, EITHER A MINIMUM OF 125 PSIG OR 1.5 TIMES THE WORKING PRESSURE WHICHEVER IS LARGER. THE MAXIMUM LEAKAGE SHALL BE CALCULATED USING THE FORMULA AS FOLLOWS:

$$ L = \frac{Q}{V_{D}I\Delta P}(ft^{2}/day), $$

Where $L$ is Length of Line Tested In Feet; $\Delta p =$ Pressure Drop Across Pipe Section ($P_t$) [PSI]; $Q =$ Flow Rate Through Waterline [$US^3$/Day] or Gallons Per Hour [(GPH)]; V$_{Di}$ = Internal Diameter Of The Pipeline Wall At Specified Test Point And Is Measured Using An ASTM Standard Gauge Instrument Or Equivalent Measurement Device With a Class 'B' Accuracy Rating For This Application Only If It Has Been Calibrated To Within ± 1 Percent From Its Last Calibration Date As Shown On Manufacturer’s Certificate Numbered on Drawings & Specifications Details Included In This Plan Set.

11. WATER LINES UNDER PROPOSED OR FUTURE PAVING AND TO WITHIN 1 FOOT BACK OF ALL PROPOSED OR FUTURE CURBS SHALL BE ENCASCED IN BANK SAND TO 12" ABOVE PIPE AND BACKFILLED WITH 15"; SACK CEMENT/ITON STABILIZED SAND TO WITHIN ONE (1) FOOT OF SUBCRADE.
12. ALL FILL AND COMPACTION TO 95% STANDARD Proctor DENSITY SHALL BE PERFORMED PRIOR TO CONSTRUCTION OF WATER LINES.
13. CONTRACTOR SHALL PROVIDE FOR A MINIMUM SEPARATION DISTANCE IN ALL DIRECTIONS OF 9' (NINE FEET) BETWEEN WATER LINES AND SANITARY SEWER MANHOLES AND LINES. IF THIS DISTANCE CANNOT BE MAINTAINED, THE CONTRACTOR MUST IMMEDIATELY NOTIFY THE PROJECT ENGINEER FOR FURTHER DIRECTION. SEPARATION DISTANCES, INSTALLATION METHODS AND MATERIALS UTILIZED MUST MEET SECTION 269(a)(4) OF CURRENT RULES.
14. WLE "INDICATES" WATER LINE ELAIGENCE.
15. "WLE." INDICATES "WATER LINE ELAIGENCE".
16. ALL WATER PIPES AND RELATED PRODUCTS MUST CONFORM TO ANSI/NSF STANDARDIZED 61 AND MUST BE CERTIFIED BY AN ORGANIZATION ACCREDITED BY ANSI.
17. HYSTEROSTATIC TESTING: ALL WATER PIPE SHALL BE TESTED FOR LEAKAGE IN ACCORDANCE WITH AWWA G40-, SECTION 4 REQUIREMENTS FOR A DURATION OF NO LESS THAN TWO HOURS. LEAKAGE SHALL BE DEFINED AS THE QUANTITY OF WATER THAT PASSES THROUGH ANY PART OF THE SYSTEM DURING SUCH PERIODS WHEN IT IS FILLED UP TO ITS MAXIMUM CAPACITY WITHOUT EXCEEDING THE SPECIFIED TEST PRESSURE AFTER THE PIPE HAS BEEN FILLED WITH WATER AND THE AIR HAS BEEN EXPELLED. THE TEST PRESSURE SHALL BE, EITHER A MINIMUM OF 125 PSIG OR 1.5 TIMES THE WORKING PRESSURE WHICHEVER IS LARGER. THE MAXIMUM LEAKAGE SHALL BE CALCULATED USING THE FORMULA AS FOLLOWS:

$$ q = (\text{LDIV})(\sqrt{\Delta p}) $$

Where LDIV = Linear Dimension Over Distance Along Subgrade Elevation Change / Vertical Rise Ratio Calculated Based Upon Data Provided By Project Engineer During Construction Phase Where Applicable.

11. PIPE SHALL NOT BE LAID IN WATER OR PLACED WHERE IT CAN BE FLOODED WITH WATER OR SEWAGE DURING ITS STORAGE OR INSTALLATION IN COMPLIANCE WITH TAC 290 44(f)(1).
12. ALL PLASTIC PIPE FOR USE IN PUBLIC WATER SYSTEMS MUST ALSO BEAR THE NATIONAL SATISATION FOUNDATION SEAL OF APPROVAL (NFSP as) AS REQUIRED IN SECTION 290.44(a)(2) OF THE RULES AND HAVE AN ASTM DESIGN PRESSURE RATINGS AT LEAST 10PSIG OR A STANDARD DIMENSION RATIO OF 26 OR LESS.
13. VALVE TYPE: NON-STIRRING O-RING SEALS, MOULER OR CLOWN CRAD. COUNTERCLOCKWISE OPENING, MECHANICAL JOINT, WITH C-900 PVC RISER.
14. FIRE HYDRANTS: MULLER BRAND, WAY 3", SWISS BARREL WITH .25" STEAMER (PUMPER) NOZZLE AND TWO (2) x (.5") HOSE NOZZLES. COUNTERCLOCKWISE OPENING MECHANICAL JOINT.
15. ALL WELL LOCATIONS TO BE MARKED ON THE CURB WITH A SAW CUT "#" PAINTED BLUE.
16. ALL INDIVIDUAL WATER SERVICE LOCATIONS TO BE MARKED ON THE CURB WITH A SAW CUT "#" PAINTED BLUE.
17. GATE TRACER WIRE TO BE PLACED ON ALL WATER MAINS & SERVICES, PER CITY OF FULSIRE REQUIREMENTS.
18. GATE VALVES SHALL BE REACHABLE BY A NON-TELESCOPIC KEY (MAX. DEPTH 5").
19. USE OF PIPE AND PIPE FITTING THAT CONTAIN MORE THAN 65% LEAD OR SOLIDS AND FLUX THAT CONTAINS MORE THAN 0.20% LEAD IS PROHIBITED PURSUANT TO 30 TAC 290.44(b)(1).
20. AIR RELEASE DEVICES SHALL BE INSTALLED IN THE DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM AT ALL POINTS WHERE TOPOGRAPHY OR OTHER FACTORS MAY CREATE AIR LOCKS IN THE LINES. AIR RELEASE DEVICES SHALL BE INSTALLED IN SUCH A MANNER AS TO PREVENT LOSS OF PRESSURIZATION DUE TO OCCASIONAL ACCESS OF CONTAMINANTS. IN THIS RESPECT, ALL OPENINGS TO THE ATMOSPHERE SHALL BE COVERED WITH 16-MESH OR FINER, CORROSION RESISTANT MATERIAL OR AT ACCEPTABLE LEVELS BASED UPON EXPERTISE OF POSSIBLE ENTRANCE OF CONTAMINANTS. IN THIS RESPECT, ALL OPENINGS TO THE ATMOSPHERE SHALL BE COVERED WITH 16-MESH OR FINER, CORROSION RESISTANT MATERIAL OR AT ACCEPTABLE LEVELS BASED UPON EXPERTISE OF POSSIBLE ENTRANCE OF CONTAMINANTS. IN THIS RESPECT, ALL OPENINGS TO THE ATMOSPHERE SHALL BE COVERED WITH 16-MESH OR FINER, CORROSION RESISTANT MATERIAL OR AT ACCEPTABLE LEVELS BASED UPON EXPERTISE OF POSSIBLE ENTRANCE OF CONTAMINANTS. IN THIS RESPECT, ALL OPENINGS TO THE ATMOSPHERE SHALL BE COVERED WITH 16-MESH OR FINER, CORROSION RESISTANT MATERIAL OR AT ACCEPTABLE LEVELS BASED UPON EXPERTISE OF POSSIBLE ENTRANCE OF CONTAMINANTS. IN THIS RESPECT, ALL OPENINGS TO THE ATMOSPHERE SHALL BE COVERED WITH 16-MESH OR FINER, CORROSION RESISTANT MATERIAL OR AT ACCEPTABLE LEVELS BASED UPON EXPERTISE OF POSSIBLE ENTRANCE OF CONTAMINANTS. IN THIS RESPECT, ALL OPENINGS
